alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 07 at 8:20PM CST until February 09 at 12:28PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Glover River At Glover affecting McCurtain County. For the Glover River...including Glover...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Glover River At Glover. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, The Glover River is at flood stage with minor flooding at its confluence with the Little River west of Golden, Oklahoma. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 4.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Wednesday morning to a crest of 16.6 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday night. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 05/08/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1030 AM CST.
